result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Craig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing After Revocation held 6-25-15 w/ EML - filed by Teresa Carnal-Kolkind  (filed in 14CF19)

PROBATION REVOCATION
Def in custody w/Atty O'Neil

assigned PO Emma Peterson
Revocation Summary

Def in custody w/atty O'Neil
O'Neil: get new date

App:  Team Anne P, Emma P, Casey, Officer / Def in custody w/ Atty Patricia O'Neil
DRG COURT - EXPULSION HEARING
CRT:  recommendation frm team was for expulsion - letter dated 3-20-15 was issued by Anne P. - Atty O'Neil has reviewed that letter w/ def
O'Neil makes comments - team wants to know what will be different this time if def allowed to stay - there is no answer to that other than for def to be given another chance to prove himself.  Def's demeanor at times looks like he doesn't care but that is not true.  Def is no longer denying fact that he used in jail - he is willing to go to whatever lengths it takes to remain in the program.  Def has even req inpatient trmt, but knows that is unlikely but will go to institutional ATR if that is recommended.  Def had a sober lifestyle in the past...has not been up for expulsion before.  Req for another chance
Def comments - knows he hasn't shown dedication...bad choices, knowing all along this would help him....wants to be positive role model - req to remain in program
CRT:  comments...if not using tools provided, absconding, does not show commitment to program.  CRT also has to take into consideration other participants - those that are working hard & being committed.  CRT encourages def to become clean & sober - sees def as someone w/ potential but appears this was not right time for DRG CRT
CRT GRANTS MOTION TO EXPEL
DRG CRT HOLD ORDER - Def shall remain detained in LCJ until further order of CRT - signed by SlH  [filed in 14CF642]
